Row.Text: {1_CivName:textkey} is their current Ally. You need another {2_NumInfluence} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence to surpass {1CivName:textkey} and become their Ally.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If a player becomes the Ally of a City-State, they receive extra bonuses relating to that City-State's trait, and they will also receive any luxury and strategic Resources the City-State has connected.
You are their current Ally. You are receiving extra bonuses, as well as any luxury or strategic Resources the City-State has connected.

An unmet player is their current Ally. You need another {1_NumInfluence} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence to surpass the unmet player and become their Ally.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If a player becomes the Ally of a City-State, they receive extra bonuses relating to that City-State's trait, and they will also receive any luxury and strategic Resources the City-State has connected.

Nobody is currently their Ally. You need another {1_NumInfluence} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence to become their Ally.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If a player becomes the Ally of a City-State, they receive extra bonuses relating to that City-State's trait, and they will also receive any luxury and strategic Resources the City-State has connected.
Your continued protection is a great comfort to us. What can we do for you?
Good, our couriers reached you in time. We have a new quest that may be of interest to you.
We are a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercantile[ENDCOLOR] people and we have many luxuries that can make your citizens happy.
We are a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Religious[ENDCOLOR] people and we can help nurture your religious traditions.
(Turns remaining: {1_TurnsRemaining})
We are still in bad shape after {1_CivName:textkey} forced us to pay them tribute. If you could provide us with some gold to get back on our feet, we would be very grateful.
They want you to give them a gift of gold.
We are tired of being pushed around by {1_CivName:textkey}. If you publicly promise to protect us, perhaps we can turn them away next time. We'll make it worth your trouble.
They want you to pledge your protection to them.
Our artists are looking for a sensible cultural power to inspire their work. If your cultural growth outpaces the other civilizations we know in the coming years, we will reward you.
They will reward the player with the largest Culture growth.
{TXT_KEY_CITY_STATE_QUEST_CONTEST_CULTURE_FORMAL} So far, you have the lead with [ICON_CULTURE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_PlayerScore}[ENDCOLOR].
{TXT_KEY_CITY_STATE_QUEST_CONTEST_CULTURE_FORMAL} So far, the leader has [ICON_CULTURE]{1_LeaderScore} and you have [ICON_CULTURE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_PlayerScore}[ENDCOLOR].
We will reward the player that gains the most Faith.
They will reward the player with the largest Faith growth.
{TXT_KEY_CITY_STATE_QUEST_CONTEST_FAITH_FORMAL} So far, you have the lead with [ICON_PEACE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_PlayerScore}[ENDCOLOR].
{TXT_KEY_CITY_STATE_QUEST_CONTEST_FAITH_FORMAL} So far, the leader has [ICON_PEACE]{1_LeaderScore} and you have [ICON_PEACE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_PlayerScore}[ENDCOLOR].
We will reward the player that discovers the most technologies.
They will reward the player that discovers the most technologies.
{TXT_KEY_CITY_STATE_QUEST_CONTEST_TECHS_FORMAL} So far, you have the lead with [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_PlayerScore}[ENDCOLOR] Technologies.
{TXT_KEY_CITY_STATE_QUEST_CONTEST_TECHS_FORMAL} So far, the leader has {1_LeaderScore} Technologies and you have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_PlayerScore}[ENDCOLOR].
Gold gifts are temporarily more effective.
Gold gifts are temporarily more effective.
We would like you to push around our rival city-states, to keep them in line.
They want you to demand tribute from {1_TargetName:textkey}.
We want you to denounce the civilization that bullied us recently, so that the world can know of their crimes.
They want you to denounce {1_TargetName:textkey}.
We want you to spread your religion to us.
They want {@1_ReligionName} to become the majority religion in their city.
We want you to defeat Barbarians that are invading our territory.
They want you to defeat Barbarian units that are invading their territory.
None
There are currently no quests this city-state has given to you. They will periodically give quests to you, but may refrain if you have bullied them recently.

A befriended [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercantile[ENDCOLOR] City-State will provide extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in your empire, and manufactures special luxury resources which cannot be acquired any other way.
A befriended [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Religious[ENDCOLOR] City-State will increase your [ICON_PEACE] Faith, allowing you to empower your religion with new beliefs and units.

A befriended [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militaristic[ENDCOLOR] City-State will provide you occasional gifts of advanced military units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They know the secrets of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_UniqueUnitName}[ENDCOLOR]. If you are their Ally and have researched {@2_PrereqTech}, they will provide that unit as their gift.
A befriended [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militaristic[ENDCOLOR] City-State will provide you occasional gifts of advanced military units.
It appears we have no choice. Take your gold, just don't hurt us.
What? How dare you! One day you will pay for this.
Ah, just what we've been looking for. Thank you for your support.
Very well, turn your back on us if you must.
They give you their treasured religious idols, awarding you [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumFaith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith[ENDCOLOR].
They share their knowledge of religious rituals, giving you [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumFaith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith[ENDCOLOR].

You have done something to anger {1_CityStateName:textkey}, such as demanding tribute, walking through their borders, or declaring war. You may complete quests or provide them a gift of [ICON_GOLD] Gold to help make amends.
{1_CityStateName:textkey} neither likes nor dislikes you. Completing quests or giving them [ICON_GOLD] Gold will improve your relations.
You are [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Friends[ENDCOLOR] with {1_CityStateName:textkey}. To become Allies, you must have more [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them than any other player.
You are [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Allies[ENDCOLOR] with {1_CityStateName:textkey}, since you have more [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them than any other player.
They will reward the player that destroys a nearby Barbarian Encampment.
You are receiving [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_CultureBonus} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture[ENDCOLOR] per turn from them.
You are receiving [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_FlatBonus} [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness[ENDCOLOR] from them.
You are receiving [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith[ENDCOLOR] per turn from them.
They recognize your military strength, and will give in to a tribute demand.
They do not fear your military, and will resist tribute demands.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]You made a promise to stop demanding tribute from a City-State protected by them, and then broke it![ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]They asked you to stop demanding tribute from a City-State protected by them, and you ignored them![ENDCOLOR]
Maintain relations with {1_CivName:textkey}, but you must revoke your pledge to protect {2_MinorCivName:textkey} and lose {3_InfluenceLoss} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence.
Maintain relations with {2_MinorCivName:textkey}, but you will anger {1_CivName:textkey} temporarily and risk an escalation to war.
Our apologies. We will leave them alone.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]You have demanded tribute from City-States under their protection![ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]They mistreated your protected City-States, and you didn't look the other way![ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]They are spreading their own religion, but you converted some of their cities to your religion.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]They have happily adopted your religion in the majority of their cities.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]You have adopted their religion in the majority of your cities.[ENDCOLOR]

New City-State Quests are available. If you complete a Quest, you will gain [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with that City-State. (To see all Quests at a glance, look at the City-States section of the Diplomacy menu.)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
New City-State Quests

You have successfully destroyed the Barbarian Encampment as requested by {1_MinorCivName:textkey}! Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR].

As {2_MinorCivName:textkey} requested, you have successfully connected {1_ResourceName} to your trade network! Their merchants are pleased, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR].
As {2_MinorCivName:textkey} requested, you have successfully constructed {1_WonderName}! Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR].

Much to the delight of {2_MinorCivName:textkey}, you have eliminated {1_TargetName:textkey}! They are extremely grateful for your assistance in this matter. Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR].

As {2_MinorCivName:textkey} requested, you have successfully created a {1_UnitName}! Their scholars are in awe, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR].

Your discovery of {1_TargetName:textkey} has greatly pleased the merchants of {2_MinorCivName:textkey}. Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR].

Your discovery of a new Natural Wonder has inspired the citizens of {1_MinorCivName:textkey}! Because of your efforts, your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR].

{2_MinorCivName:textkey} was forced to pay tribute to {1_BullyName:textkey} recently, and now its treasury is empty. They are asking for a gift of gold to help them get back on their feet. If you help them, they will reward you, and they will be more resilient against future tribute requests.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} is bankrupt!

Your gift of gold has helped {2_MinorCivName:textkey} recover from the tribute paid to {1_BullyName:textkey}! Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR], and they are more resistant to future tribute demands.
Gold support given to {1_MinorCivName:textkey}!
{2_MinorCivName:textkey} was forced to pay tribute to {1_BullyName:textkey} recently, and seeks protection from a major power. If you pledge to protect them, they will reward you.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} seeks protection!

Your promise to protect {2_MinorCivName:textkey} has helped them recover from the tribute paid to {1_BullyName:textkey}! Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR], and they are more resistant to future tribute demands.
Protection pledged to {1_MinorCivName:textkey}!

The arts are flourishing in {3_MinorCivName:textkey}, and they seek cultural guidance. Whoever can produce the most [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in a period of {2_TurnsDuration} turns will gain [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them. [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_TurnsRemaining} turns remaining.[ENDCOLOR]
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} longs for culture!

You have impressed {1_MinorCivName:textkey} with your culture! They turn a blind eye to the culture of other civilizations, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR]. Civilizations that succeeded (ties are allowed):[NEWLINE]
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} is in awe of you!

Another civilization has impressed {1_MinorCivName:textkey} with its culture. Your cultural growth was not enough, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence remains the same as before. Civilizations that succeeded (ties are allowed):[NEWLINE]
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} looks elsewhere

The people of {3_MinorCivName:textkey} look to worldly affairs for religious guidance. Whoever can garner the most [ICON_PEACE] Faith in a period of {2_TurnsDuration} turns will gain [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them. [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_TurnsRemaining} turns remaining.[ENDCOLOR]
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} calls for faith!

The priesthood of {1_MinorCivName:textkey} are moved by your piety. They shun the inferior faith of other civilizations, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR]. Civilizations that succeeded (ties are allowed):[NEWLINE]
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} is in awe of you!

Another civilization has impressed {1_MinorCivName:textkey} with its faith. Your faith growth was not enough, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence remains the same as before. Civilizations that succeeded (ties are allowed):[NEWLINE]
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} looks elsewhere

The foremost intellectuals of {3_MinorCivName:textkey} seek closer relations with civilizations that quickly uncover new scientific discoveries. Whoever can discover the most Technologies in a period of {2_TurnsDuration} turns will gain [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them. [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_TurnsRemaining} turns remaining.[ENDCOLOR]
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} searches for science!

{1_MinorCivName:textkey} is amazed by your swift technological advancements! Their scientists and intellectuals dismiss other civilizations as stagnant, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR]. Civilizations that succeeded (ties are allowed):[NEWLINE]
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} is in awe of you!

Another civilization has impressed {1_MinorCivName:textkey} with its technological advancement. Your scientific discoveries were not enough, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence remains the same as before. Civilizations that succeeded (ties are allowed):[NEWLINE]
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} looks elsewhere

{3_MinorCivName:textkey} is undertaking a large public works project. Each gold gift to them during this time will be more effective, rewarding [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_BoostPercentage}%[ENDCOLOR] more [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence. [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_TurnsRemaining} turns remaining.[ENDCOLOR]
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} seeks investors!
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} has completed its project. Amount of [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence gained from gold gifts returns to normal.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} no longer needs investors
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} has completed its project. Amount of [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence gained from gold gifts returns to normal.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} no longer needs investors

The leaders of {2_MinorCivName:textkey} have been keeping an eye on the prosperity of other City-States, and want you to help keep their rivals in check. If you demand any type of tribute from {1_TargetName:textkey}, they will reward you.
{2_MinorCivName:textkey} wants {1_TargetName:textkey} bullied

{2_MinorCivName:textkey} enjoyed seeing its rival {1_TargetName:textkey} squirm and give up hard earned resources. Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR]!
{1_TargetName:textkey} bullied for {2_MinorCivName:textkey}!

{2_MinorCivName:textkey} was bullied by {1_TargetName:textkey} recently, and they are looking for some way to bring this injustice to the attention of major world powers. If you denounce {1_TargetName:textkey}, they will be very grateful and reward you.
{2_MinorCivName:textkey} seeks justice against {1_TargetName:textkey}

{2_MinorCivName:textkey} is relieved that the injustice they suffered at the hands of {1_TargetName:textkey} is now known by major world powers. Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR]!
{1_TargetName:textkey} denounced for {2_MinorCivName:textkey}!

A group of citizens from {@2_MinorCivName} has heard the tenets of {@1_ReligionName} and wants you to spread the religion to their city. If {@1_ReligionName} becomes the majority religion, your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them will grow.
{@2_MinorCivName} wants {@1_ReligionName}

Citizens of {@2_MinorCivName} are glad to see {@1_ReligionName} come to their city and become the dominant religion. Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR]!
{@1_ReligionName} spread to {@2_MinorCivName}
After waiting for a long time, the leaders of {1_MinorCivName:textkey} have decided to cancel a quest they had previously given to you.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} cancels quest
Because you demanded tribute from {1_MinorCivName:textkey}, they have revoked quests previously offered to you. Time must pass before they will freely offer you quests again.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} revokes quests
As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercantile[ENDCOLOR] City-State, their markets offer exotic goods to your people! (+{1_NumHappiness} [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness)
As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Religious[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they share their knowledge of rituals with you! (+{1_NumFaith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith per turn)
({1_NumHappiness} [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness)
({1_NumFaith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith per turn lost)
As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercantile[ENDCOLOR] City-State, their markets spread trade of exotic goods across your empire! (+{1_NumHappiness} [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness)
As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Religious[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they give you their most treasured religious relics! (+{1_NumFaith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith per turn)
As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militaristic[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they will regularly give you military Units. Sometimes they will give you Unique Units that you normally would not have access to.
City-States grow wary

Your aggression against your weaker neighbors has not gone unnoticed. The resting point for [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence has decreased by [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_InfluenceMinimum}[ENDCOLOR] for these city-states, making it more costly to maintain friendship:[NEWLINE]
MAYA LONG COUNT BONUS
The current b'ak'tun of the Maya Long Count calendar has ended. Choose a bonus to celebrate this milestone in Maya history!
GREAT PERSON FROM FAITH!
You have accumulated enough Faith to earn a Great Person of your choice!
{1_CivName:textkey} used a Great General to steal some of your land!
{@2_MinorCivName} joins {@1_CivName} by marriage!

A beautiful princess of {@1_CivName} has been married off to a nobleman of {@2_MinorCivName}. With a diplomatic relationship united by marriage, {@2_MinorCivName} has become a permanent part of {@1_CivName}.

A handsome prince of {@1_CivName} has been married off to a noblewoman of {@2_MinorCivName}. With a diplomatic relationship united by marriage, {@2_MinorCivName} has become a permanent part of {@1_CivName}.
Are you sure you want to demand tribute from {1_MinorCivName:textkey}?
Are you sure you want to demand tribute from {@1_MinorCivName}? They are currently under the protection of: {@2_CivName}.
Are you sure you want to demand tribute from {@1_MinorCivName}? They are currently under the protection of: {2_ListOfCivs}.
Ask for Tribute
City-States can provide [ICON_GOLD] Gold and Units, but taking these by force will decrease your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them.
Find on Map
ALLY:
Resources:
QUESTS:

Pledging to protect a City-State lets the other major powers in the game know that you will protect the City-State from attacks and tribute demands. This may deter players who don't want to risk a conflict with you, but the City-State will expect you to take its side when it is attacked or bullied.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]During protection, your resting point for [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with this City-State is increased by {1_InfluenceMinimum}. Protection cannot be revoked until {2_TurnsMinimum} turns after the pledge is made.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You must be at peace and have {1_InfluenceNeededToPledge} or more [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence to pledge.[ENDCOLOR]

[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Because you did not honor your previous pledge, this City-State does not trust you. {1_TurnsUntilPledgeAvailable} turns must pass before you can pledge again.[ENDCOLOR]
Revoke Protection
You can cancel your pledge to protect this City-State. Other major powers will be aware of this, and may change their actions towards this City-State as a result.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You have committed protection for at least {1_TurnsRemaining} more turns and may not revoke protection until that time has passed.[ENDCOLOR]
Diplomatic Marriage

You may spend {1_BuyoutCost} [ICON_GOLD] Gold to acquire this City-State through diplomatic marriage, making it and all of its units part of your empire. This will not incur the diplomatic penalties or the Unhappiness penalties of conquering the City-State. The bonuses and World Congress delegates you receive from friendship with this City-State, however, will be lost.

You may spend {2_BuyoutCost} [ICON_GOLD] Gold to acquire this City-State through diplomatic marriage, making it and all of its units part of your empire. This will not incur the diplomatic penalties or the Unhappiness penalties of conquering the City-State. The bonuses and World Congress delegates you receive from friendship with this City-State, however, will be lost.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You must be allied for {1_NumTurns} turns and have {2_BuyoutCost} [ICON_GOLD] Gold to acquire this City-State.[ENDCOLOR]

You may spend {3_BuyoutCost} [ICON_GOLD] Gold to acquire this City-State through diplomatic marriage, making it and all of its units part of your empire. This will not incur the diplomatic penalties or the Unhappiness penalties of conquering the City-State. The bonuses and World Congress delegates you receive from friendship with this City-State, however, will be lost.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]You must be allied for {1_NumTurns} turns ({2_TurnsAllied} turns so far) and have {3_BuyoutCost} [ICON_GOLD] Gold to acquire this City-State.[ENDCOLOR]
Build a Tile Improvement on this tile for this City-State, giving it access to the resource.
Afraid
You have founded the new religion {@1_ReligionName} in the holy city of {@2_CityName}.
{1_CivName} {1: plural 1?has; 2?have;} founded the new religion {@2_ReligionName} in the holy city of {@3_CityName}.
An unknown civilization has founded the new religion {@1_ReligionName} in one of their cities.
Religion Founded
Your people have started worshipping a pantheon of gods. They have chosen the belief: {1_BeliefName} ({@2_BeliefDesc})
{@1_CivName} {@1: plural 1?has; 2?have;} started worshipping a pantheon of gods. They have chosen the belief: {2_BeliefName} ({@3_BeliefDesc})
An unknown civilization has started worshipping a pantheon of gods. They have chosen the belief: {1_BeliefName} ({@2_BeliefDesc})
Pantheon Founded
You have enhanced the religion {@1_ReligionName} by adding new beliefs.
{1_CivName} {1: plural 1?has; 2?have;} enhanced their religion {@2_ReligionName} by adding new beliefs.
An unknown civilization has enhanced their religion {@1_ReligionName} by adding new beliefs.
Religion Enhanced
{1_CityName} has adopted a religion!
Your City Becomes Religious
{1_CityName} has been converted to another religion!
Your City Converted
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Oligarchy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Garrisoned units cost no maintenance and cities with a garrison gain +50% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aesthetics[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Resting point for [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with all City-States is increased by 20.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Freedom[ENDCOLOR] is best for small, focused empires. In particular, it provides bonuses for [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People and Specialists.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Upon adopting Freedom, the rate at which [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People are born is increased by 25%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Freedom tree will increase the base yield from Great Tile Improvements by 100% and length of [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages increased by 50%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May purchase Great Artists with [ICON_PEACE] Faith.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This branch cannot be active at the same time as Autocracy or Order.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Order[ENDCOLOR] is best for large, sprawling empires, increasing the strength of the empire based on the number of Cities it contains.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Order will increase [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness by +1 per City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Order tree will grant +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture per city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May purchase Great Engineers with [ICON_PEACE] Faith.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This branch cannot be active at the same time as Freedom or Autocracy.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Autocracy[ENDCOLOR] is for militaristic civilizations, dreaming of world conquest.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Autocracy reduces Unit [ICON_GOLD] Gold Maintenance costs by 33%, allowing an empire to field a larger military. Receive 10 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture as plunder for each point of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture produced in the captured city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Autocracy tree will grant a 25% attack bonus to all Military Units for 50 turns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May purchase Great Generals and Great Admirals with [ICON_PEACE] Faith.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This branch cannot be active at the same time as Freedom or Order.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Organized Religion[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith from Shrines and Temples.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Military Caste[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Each City with a garrison increases Local City [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness by 1 and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture by 2.
Religious Tolerance
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Protectionism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from each Luxury resource.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercantilism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Purchasing items in Cities requires 25% less [ICON_GOLD] Gold. +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from every Mint, Market, Bank, and Stock Exchange.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Total War[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+25% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Military Units and new Military Units start with +15 Experience.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Planned Economy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Factories increase a city's [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output by 25%. Build Factories in half the usual time.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Communism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production per City and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for every Mine or Quarry.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fascism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Quantity of Strategic Resources produced by the empire increased by 100%. All Great Generals receive +2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Sovereignty[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_RESEARCH] Science buildings.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Scientific Revolution[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Boosts [ICON_RESEARCH] Science gained from research agreements by 50%.
[ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and [ICON_PEACE] Faith from friendly City-States increased by 50%.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Courthouse costs half as much and produces 1 Culture[ENDCOLOR] All melee naval units have the Prize Ships promotion, allowing them to capture defeated ships. Pay only one-third the usual cost for naval unit maintenance.
+2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for all naval units. Receives 1 extra Spy.
It will increase the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture provided by this tile, spreading our borders and allowing us to gain more social policies.
This order will consume the Great Person and will result in the creation of a new religion.
Unit must be in one of your cities.

This order will convert some of the citizens of the nearby city to the unit's religion. This unit will be consumed if this is their final Spread Religion action. Spreading by Great Prophets also removes the influence of other religions.
Unit must be in or adjacent to a city (it does not have to be a friendly city).
After this action is performed [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_NumFollowers}[ENDCOLOR] citizens will be following [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ReligionName}[ENDCOLOR].
The majority religion for this city will be [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ReligionName}[ENDCOLOR].
There will not be a majority religion in this city.
This order will remove the presence of other religions from the nearby, friendly-controlled city. An inquisitor is consumed by this action.
Unit must be in or adjacent to a friendly city.
This order will consume the Great Person and will allow you to add two new beliefs to your religion. You will also have the option to buy Inquisitors to defend your religion.
Unit must be in the Holy City for this religion.
This order will consume the Great Admiral and heal all of your naval units and embarked units in this tile and all adjacent tiles.
This order will consume the Great Artist and initiate a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age (extra [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture) for {1_Num} turns.
You have found an ancient oracle. The priestess has blessed you with a divine revelation. You have received {1_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
You have found a secret religious community. The preacher foretells the arrival of a Great Prophet. You have received {1_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
ACCEPT EMBASSY
Allows Open Border and Defensive Pacts. Also allows you to see the location of the other player's Capital.

+100% [ICON_STRENGTH] Defensive Strength for any Unit stationed in this Tile. Any enemy unit which ends its turn next to the Citadel takes 30 damage (damage does not stack with other Citadels). Constructing the Citadel will expand your Culture borders to surround the Citadel, and will consume this unit. If the new Culture border claims hexes already owned by another civilization, you will incur a diplomatic penalty as a result.
